obfuscation: ﻿When I was held an assignment to write an essay , in which I 'm asked to evaluate my strengths and weaknesses in the English language , it did leave me pondering over the matter a great deal .
original: ﻿When I was given an assignment to write an essay, in which I'm asked to evaluate my strengths and weaknesses in the English language, it did leave me pondering over the matter a great deal.

obfuscation: I have n't thought about my skills in English for many years and nowadays I realize why .
original: I haven't thought about my skills in English for many years and now I realize why.

obfuscation: It 's simply because I have n't practised them enough since I graduated from school which , I might as well add , I made ten years ago .
original: It's simply because I haven't practised them enough since I graduated from school which, I might as well add, I did ten years ago.

obfuscation: I had at that point spent an additional year in the United States , as a foreign exchange student .
original: I had at that point spent an additional year in the United States, as a foreign exchange student.

obfuscation: Returning to Sweden after my stay there I was more confident than ever about my English skills being good , and for some unexplanatory reason I 've continued that confidence throughout the years .
original: Returning to Sweden after my stay there I was more confident than ever about my English skills being good, and for some unexplanatory reason I've kept that confidence throughout the years.

obfuscation: Going back to school , to study English here in Uppsala , has however brought me preferably abruptly back to earth , if not deeper .
original: Going back to school, to study English here in Uppsala, has however brought me rather abruptly back to earth, if not deeper.

obfuscation: This inaugural week at school has been the first confrontation with English for a very long time , and I 've come to the conclusion that I do have forgotten very much .
original: This first week at school has been the first confrontation with English for a very long time, and I've come to the conclusion that I do have forgotten very much.

obfuscation: It 's a shame that I 've hardly talked or written anything in English for such a long time , and that I 've still expected my English skills to be good .
original: It's a shame that I've hardly spoken or written anything in English for such a long time, and that I've still expected my English skills to be good.

obfuscation: Of course I 've been abroad a couple of times which has given me the opportunitiy to get conversations in English , but a short conversation in a foreign language once or twice a year is not enough .
original: Of course I've been abroad a couple of times which has given me the opportunitiy to have conversations in English, but a short conversation in a foreign language once or twice a year is not enough.

obfuscation: A habit that I do have continued throughout the years is the habit of reading .
original: A habit that I do have kept throughout the years is the habit of reading.

obfuscation: I 've always take a lot , mostly in Swedish but often books in English as well .
original: I've always read a lot, mostly in Swedish but often books in English as well.

obfuscation: Even though I usually tend to read `` best-sellers '' , not very heavy literature that is , I think myself a fairly good reader .
original: Even though I usually tend to read "best-sellers", not very heavy literature that is, I consider myself a fairly good reader.

obfuscation: It depends on sake , naturally , as it takes me much longer to finish a book I 'm not interested in compared to one in which I am .
original: It depends on interest, naturally, as it takes me much longer to finish a book I'm not interested in compared to one in which I am.

obfuscation: Even `` best-sellers '' hold a great many words I 'm not able to translate into Swedish , and I often have to look them up in a dictionary .
original: Even "best-sellers" contain a great many words I'm not able to translate into Swedish, and I often have to look them up in a dictionary.

obfuscation: More much , however , I do n't look them up as you understand the meaning in the context of the text .
original: More often, however, I don't look them up as you understand the meaning in the context of the text.

obfuscation: I see my skills in listening to spoken language as good as in written one .
original: I consider my skills in listening to spoken language as good as in written one.

obfuscation: As long as the speaker has became an accent to which I 'm familiar , I 've got no trouble what so ever to follow .
original: As long as the speaker has got an accent to which I'm familiar, I've got no trouble what so ever to follow.

obfuscation: I 've noticed , however , that I do have a harder time to understand a British accent than an American one .
original: I've noticed, however, that I do have a harder time to understand a British accent than an American one.

obfuscation: This becomes quite clear to me especially when I 'm watching TV .
original: This becomes quite clear to me especially when I'm watching TV.

obfuscation: Considering the fact that I 've been exposed to the American accent daily for a year in my youth , and additionally watch American Shows on TV in much greater extent than I watch British ones , it makes make sense to me .
original: Considering the fact that I've been exposed to the American accent daily for a year in my youth, and additionally watch American Shows on TV in much greater extent than I watch British ones, it does make sense to me.

obfuscation: Talking of accents , I would like to cover my skills of speaking , in the meaning of my own ability to speak English .
original: Talking of accents, I would like to cover my skills of speaking, in the meaning of my own ability to speak English.

obfuscation: I remember coming back from the US with a fluency in spoken English I 'd never had before .
original: I remember coming back from the US with a fluency in spoken English I'd never had before.

obfuscation: I went proudly back to school , as I however had one more year to attand before graduation , being proud of my improvement in English .
original: I went proudly back to school, as I still had one more year to attand before graduation, being proud of my improvement in English.

obfuscation: The teacher , on the early hand , made it immediately very clear to me that she did n't approve of my American accent .
original: The teacher, on the other hand, made it immediately very clear to me that she didn't approve of my American accent.

obfuscation: British accent and spelling were all what she accepted , and was therfore on my back all the time .
original: British accent and spelling were all what she accepted, and was therfore on my back all the time.

obfuscation: I was very unhappy about this , I still am , because it mixed everything up in a manner .
original: I was very unhappy about this, I still am, because it mixed everything up in a way.

obfuscation: I 'm however , at this day , confused in the matter .
original: I'm still, at this day, confused in the matter.

obfuscation: I 've noticed , especially when I speak , that I pronounce words unlike all the time .
original: I've noticed, especially when I speak, that I pronounce words different all the time.

obfuscation: I try thus hard to get a British accent but I always end up speaking with a Swedish-British-American pronounciation which I 'm not pleased with .
original: I try so hard to get a British accent but I always end up speaking with a Swedish-British-American pronounciation which I'm not pleased with.

obfuscation: Pronounciation and fluency in speech will be trained daily , among early things , at the University , and I look forward to recieve this training .
original: Pronounciation and fluency in speech will be trained daily, among other things, at the University, and I look forward to recieve this training.

obfuscation: I 've realized that I want it ... ..
original: I've realized that I need it.....

obfuscation: Sitting here , writing the essay on the computer , makes this very moment a hitorical one .
original: Sitting here, writing the essay on the computer, makes this very moment a hitorical one.

obfuscation: In what manner , you as a reader might ask .
original: In what way, you as a reader might ask.

obfuscation: Well , this is actually the inaugural time ever I 've written anything in English on the computer .
original: Well, this is actually the first time ever I've written anything in English on the computer.

obfuscation: I was introduced to IT rather late in my life , and made n't get the hang of it until a couple of months ago .
original: I was introduced to IT rather late in my life, and didn't get the hang of it until a couple of months ago.

obfuscation: It 's not the computer alone I find a bit awkward , it 's also the fact that I have n't written anything in English , especially not an essay , for many , many years .
original: It's not the computer alone I find a bit awkward, it's also the fact that I haven't written anything in English, especially not an essay, for many, many years.

obfuscation: I honestly make n't recall the last time I wrote ... . anything .
original: I honestly don't recall the last time I wrote.... anything.

obfuscation: But once you get started it 's difficult to stop as I do n't mind writing at all .
original: But once you get started it's difficult to stop as I don't mind writing at all.

obfuscation: In fact I like it very a lot , and I 'm positive about that my writing skills , and the other skills , will be improved during this term .
original: In fact I like it very much, and I'm positive about that my writing skills, and the other skills, will be improved during this term.

obfuscation: Some things I 've forgotten will come back to me , and other things I 'll teach .
original: Some things I've forgotten will come back to me, and other things I'll learn.

obfuscation: There is no doubt about it .
original: There is no question about it.

obfuscation: Or at least I would n't like to think so .
original: Or at least I wouldn't like to believe so.
